features: Highly Effective at an Excellent Value: Milliard premium descaling powder is specially formulated to remove hard water deposits, improve taste, and preserve the lifespan of your coffee maker.
Safe and Effective: Formulated with non-toxic, food-grade ingredients; Suitable for all coffee machine types; Safe to use in Keurigs, Breville, Cuisinart, Mr Coffee, Bunn and more

Easy to Use: Add Milliard descaling powder to your water reservoir and run a descaling cycle according to the included instructions; For best results, use every 3-6 months or when symptoms of hard water buildup appear
Long-Lasting Value: Each 1-pound bag provides 9 descaling cycles; An affordable and convenient way to maintain your coffee maker's performance

Milliard Guarantee: We stand behind the quality of our products and offer a satisfaction guarantee; If you are not completely satisfied, feel free to reach out to our dedicated customer service team will be glad to assist you.
body.description: Milliard premium descaling powder enhances the flavor of coffee by eliminating hard water deposits that can accumulate in your coffee maker. These deposits can affect the taste of your coffee by imparting unwanted flavors or reducing the brewing efficiency. By removing these deposits, Milliard descaling powder helps ensure that your coffee maker operates optimally, resulting in a cleaner brewing process and a better-tasting cup of coffee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works really well
reviews.reviewText: I've used number of things to clean my Keurig coffee brewer with varying degrees of success. The Keurig cleaning solution worked, but was expensive; vinegar also worked, but took a number of tries to get rid of the vinegar taste.I followed the directions on the package, including the wait time. and the results were marvelous. Not only is this the least expensive method I've tried, but it is also the best. My first cup of coffee the ext morning was terrific. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I used for my Keurig. It is definitely an inexpensive descaler for your machines. The taste of my coffee afterwards did improve some. Will continue to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I used this Milliard Descaler powder in my Keurig Duo coffee machine. The descale indicator had not yet turned on but the amount of water dispensed was beginning to vary, indicating that I needed to descale the machine. (We get a lot of white crusty residue from our water.) I mixed the powder as directed and poured it into the reservoir. My reservoir is large so it took all the solution. I first brewed a carafe of 12 cups to clean the carafe side of the machine. Once that was done I poured the liquid back into the reservoir so that I could brew on the K-cup side. I ran the K-cup side for one 12 ounce session then left the machine sit for several hours. When I returned I ran the rest of the descaler through the K-cup side. Once I finished with the descaler liquid I filled the reservoir again and ran a 12 cup carafe then I filled the reservoir and ran four 12 oz. cups on the K-cup side.The directions say to fill the reservoir once and flush the machine, but I did it twice just to be sure. Coffee the next morning was fine, no funny taste due to the descaler.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I used this descaler on my Nespresso machine. Usually, the descaler I purchase from Nespresso is some sort of scary chemical concoction, so I like that this is natural/food-grade material. It seemed to work well and cleaned out the gunk from inside my machine. Maybe between the cost of this and the less toxic material, I will actually clean my machine on a regular basis!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked as described.
reviews.reviewText: Better than using vinegar to clean your coffee machine. Followed the directions, including the wait times, and it worked great. No descale light coming on and the machine is cleaner. Flushed it more than two times to be sure and no taste at all the next morning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Descaler is just Citric Acid
reviews.reviewText: I should have read about more carefully. It is just citric acid and I already had a big bag of that on hand. It works just fine and is about what you would expect. It just isn't anything fancy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An easy way to clean your coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: The Milliard Descaling Powder makes it easy to clean your coffee machine. I have never descaled my machine before, and the directions were straightforward and simple to follow. I can't say that I have noticed any difference in flavor between before and after descaling, so I just have to assume it did the job. I recommend this descaling powder for any household coffee maker.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I trust Milliard for quality and effectiveness
reviews.reviewText: I guess I wasn't paying attention when I ordered this Milliard Descaler Powder, 1 lb. It's made of citric acid.A while back I bought a larger bag (maybe 3lbs?) of Milliard food grade citric acid to clean my tannin filter and iron filter in my vacation home. It did a great job and saved me a lot of money. I can attest to the purity and effectiveness of this product to remove scale, mineral buildup, or whatever unwanted deposits you may have in a unit that processes consumables (such as water, drinks, food, etc) This is safe to use in recommended doses, as citric acid is also used in many food products.I bit of a warning, though. Don't put too high of a concentration in whatever you are cleaning. It will leave a tart taste that won't go away for quite a while, and it could damage your equipment. Fortunately the container has directions on how to descale your coffee maker. Also, if you are using it on a machine that has an inlet water filter cartridge, such as a commercial Keurig, be sure to bypass the filter, as descaler will contaminate the membrane and leave a permanent taste in it. And remember to flush your machine several times to remove any residual aftertaste.If you have any minerals in your drinking water, then you probably have buildup in your coffee maker that will eventually slow down or plug up parts of the machine. This is enough for many, many de-scalings.
